---
title: "redis-tls-insecure.yml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML configuration file defines settings for a cache system using Redis as the backend. It enables caching, sets Redis as the backend, specifies a Time-To-Live (TTL) for cached items, and configures the Redis connection to skip TLS verification.

## Symbols

### `cache`
#### Description
The root configuration object for the caching system.

#### Internal Logic
- Enables the cache system
- Specifies Redis as the backend
- Sets a TTL for cached items
- Configures Redis-specific settings

### `cache.enabled`
#### Description
A boolean flag to enable or disable the caching system.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| enabled | boolean | When set to `true`, the caching system is enabled |

### `cache.backend`
#### Description
Specifies the caching backend to be used.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| backend | string | Set to `"redis"` to use Redis as the caching backend |

### `cache.ttl`
#### Description
Defines the Time-To-Live (TTL) for cached items.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| ttl | duration | Set to `"60s"`, indicating a 60-second TTL for cached items |

### `cache.redis`
#### Description
Contains Redis-specific configuration options.

### `cache.redis.insecure_skip_tls`
#### Description
A boolean flag to control TLS verification for the Redis connection.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| insecure_skip_tls | boolean | When set to `true`, TLS verification is skipped for the Redis connection |

## Configuration
| Option | Type | Default | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| cache.enabled | boolean | true | Enables the caching system |
| cache.backend | string | "redis" | Specifies Redis as the caching backend |
| cache.ttl | duration | "60s" | Sets the Time-To-Live for cached items to 60 seconds |
| cache.redis.insecure_skip_tls | boolean | true | Skips TLS verification for the Redis connection |

## Side Effects
Skipping TLS verification (insecure_skip_tls: true) can potentially expose the system to security risks, as it bypasses certificate validation when connecting to the Redis server. This should be used with caution and only in controlled environments where the risks are understood and mitigated.
